summary: The Pride In Mental Health Act of 2025 aims to improve mental health outcomes for LGBTQ+ youth. It amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize grants for eligible entities to provide mental health services, crisis intervention, cultural competency training, and evidence-based practices for this population. The bill also includes provisions for data collection, school bullying prevention guidelines, mental health service integration in schools, patient navigator programs, family acceptance models, and a federal survey. Furthermore, it prohibits the use of grant funds for conversion therapy and requires reviews and updates of related reports. Funding of $20 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030 is authorized.
